content.question: A characteristic of eighteenth-century harmony and voice-leading practice is not observed in the chord progression heard. Which of the following statements describes the problem?

choices.label: Ⅰ—ⅲ—Ⅰ is a weak progression; the iii chord is rarely used unless it is part of a descending fifth sequence.
Ⅰ—Ⅴ—Ⅳ is considered a harmonic retrogression and is avoided in this style.
A cadential six-four chord is heard on the weak beat; in this style it should occur on a strong beat.
A passing six-four chord is heard on the strong beat; in this style it should occur on a weak beat.

content.answer: Ⅰ—ⅲ—Ⅰ is a weak progression; the iii chord is rarely used unless it is part of a descending fifth sequence.
